critique: This executive order aims to prevent discrimination in defense industries based on race, creed, color, or national origin. It establishes a committee to investigate complaints and redress grievances. It promotes social inclusion and equal opportunity. It could be seen as slightly expanding executive power through the creation of the committee, but it is primarily focused on ensuring fair employment practices. The order does not directly address immigration, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or economic regulation in a significant way.
